title: Relates to crime of petit larceny
summary: Changes the crime of petit larceny to petit larceny in the second degree and adds new crime of petit larceny in the first degree defined as the stealing of property by a person who has been convicted two or more times of petit larceny in the first or second degree within the preceding five years.

         sored by -- M. of A.  BOYLAND, MARKEY, MAYERSOHN,  PHEFFER,  ROBINSON,
         TOWNS, WEISENBERG -- read once and referred to the Committee on Codes

       AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to repeat offender status for
         petit larceny offenses

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 155.25 of the penal  law  is  amended  to  read  as
    2  follows:
    3  S 155.25  Petit larceny IN THE SECOND DEGREE.
    4    A  person  is  guilty of petit larceny IN THE SECOND DEGREE when he OR
    5  SHE steals property.
    6    Petit larceny IN THE SECOND DEGREE is a class A misdemeanor.
    7    S 2. The penal law is amended by adding a new section 155.26  to  read
    8  as follows:
    9  S 155.26 PETIT LARCENY IN THE FIRST DEGREE.
   10    A PERSON IS GUILTY OF PETIT LARCENY IN THE FIRST DEGREE WHEN HE OR SHE
   11  STEALS PROPERTY AND HAS BEEN CONVICTED TWO OR MORE TIMES OF PETIT LARCE-
   12  NY UNDER SECTION 155.25 OR THIS SECTION WITHIN THE PRECEDING FIVE YEARS.
   13    PETIT LARCENY IN THE FIRST DEGREE IS A CLASS E FELONY.
   14    S 3. This act shall take effect on the first of November next succeed-
   15  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.




        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
